From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/30/2024 7:23 PM
To: david.monroe@alyeska-pipeline.com
Cc: yaniq.campbell@netwrix.com; kirill.maurits@alyeska-pipeline.com; cristian.tornea@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: SSH access request [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0DSqlm:ref ]

Hi David, Hi Kirill,

I just received the document from our legal team and I will attach it to this email. Please let me know if you have trouble finding it.
Once you download the file please go over it, fill in the relevant details, and send it back to us along with the authorized signer's details.
After our legal team gets back to me I will let you know the next step.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/24/2024 6:26 PM
To: david.monroe@alyeska-pipeline.com
Cc: yaniq.campbell@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: SSH access request [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0DSqlm:ref ]

Hi David,

In order to have SSH access I will reach out to our legal department and they will provide a document that you must review and sign.
Once I return the signed document I will be notified and we will set a remote session where I can provide the offline patch that will create the account in the backend.
After that, we are done.
Let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com



--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/24/2024 6:19 PM
To: david.monroe@alyeska-pipeline.com
Cc: yaniq.campbell@netwrix.com; kirill.maurits@alyeska-pipeline.com
Subject: RE: SSH access request [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0DSqlm:ref ]

Hi David, Kirill,

I apologize for the delayed follow up on this,

We finally have a way to enable a separate SSH account for your team, without having to request control of the screen in a remote session.

It will be done through uploading an offline patch in the UI.

My colleague Eduard will get back to you shortly to let you know the next steps for this process.

Thank you and best regards,

__________________
Cristian Tornea
Senior Technical Support Engineer & Shift Lead  (US/Canada/LATAM)

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery

We are currently checking internally on how we could achieve that without having to connect SSH and we will get back to you as soon as we have an update.

Thank you and best regards,
